filmography.title: Citizen Kane
filmography.role_description: A wealthy newspaper tycoon whose rise and fall is investigated by a reporter seeking the meaning of his dying word, "Rosebud".
filmography.plot: Following the death of a publishing tycoon, news reporters scramble to discover the meaning of his final utterance.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Screenplay; Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor

filmography.title: The Third Man
filmography.role_description: A charismatic but amoral racketeer in post-war Vienna who fakes his own death to evade the authorities.
filmography.plot: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Grand Prize of the Festival

filmography.title: Touch of Evil
filmography.role_description: A corrupt, bloated, and bigoted police captain in a Mexican border town who frames suspects to maintain his perfect conviction record.
filmography.plot: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.

filmography.title: Chimes at Midnight
filmography.role_description: The tragicomic, gluttonous companion to Prince Hal, who is ultimately rejected when the prince becomes King Henry V.
filmography.plot: The career of Shakespeare's Sir John Falstaff as roistering companion to young Prince Hal, and his rejection when the Prince becomes King.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – 20th Anniversary Prize

filmography.title: The Lady from Shanghai
filmography.role_description: A naive Irish sailor who gets drawn into a complex murder plot by a beautiful femme fatale and her disabled husband.
filmography.plot: A seaman becomes involved in a complex murder plot when he is hired to work on a yacht.

filmography.title: The Stranger
filmography.role_description: An escaped Nazi war criminal hiding in a small Connecticut town under the guise of a respectable professor.
filmography.plot: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

filmography.title: Jane Eyre
filmography.role_description: The brooding, mysterious master of Thornfield Hall who hides a dark secret from his young governess.
filmography.plot: After a harsh childhood, orphan Jane Eyre is hired by Edward Rochester, the brooding lord of a mysterious manor house.

filmography.title: A Man for All Seasons
filmography.role_description: The powerful Lord Chancellor of England who tries to pressure Sir Thomas More into supporting the King's divorce.
filmography.plot: The story of Sir Thomas More, who stood up to King Henry VIII when the King rejected the Roman Catholic Church to obtain a divorce and remarry.

filmography.title: Compulsion
filmography.role_description: A brilliant defense attorney based on Clarence Darrow who fights to save two thrill-killing students from the death penalty.
filmography.plot: Two wealthy law students go on trial for murder in this version of the Leopold-Loeb case.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Othello
filmography.role_description: The tragic Moor of Venice who is manipulated into a jealous rage by his ensign, Iago.
filmography.plot: The Moorish General Othello is manipulated into thinking that his new wife Desdemona has been carrying on an affair with his lieutenant Michael Cassio.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Palme d'Or (Best Film)

filmography.title: The Trial
filmography.role_description: The Advocate, a grotesque and corrupt figure who represents the nightmarish legal system trapping the protagonist.
filmography.plot: An unassuming office worker is arrested and stands trial, but he is never made aware of his charges.

filmography.title: F for Fake
filmography.role_description: Welles plays himself as a magician and raconteur, weaving a complex web of truths and lies about art forgery.
filmography.plot: Orson Welles' free-form documentary about fakery, focusing on the notorious art forger Elmyr de Hory and his biographer, Clifford Irving.

filmography.title: Macbeth
filmography.role_description: The ambitious Scottish lord who is driven to murder his king by prophecy and his wife's urging.
filmography.plot: Macbeth, the Thane of Glamis, receives a prophecy from a trio of witches that one day he will become King of Scotland.

filmography.title: The Long, Hot Summer
filmography.role_description: A domineering, wealthy patriarch of a Mississippi town who seeks a suitable husband for his daughter.
filmography.plot: Con man Ben Quick arrives in a small Mississippi town and ingratiates himself with the town's richest family, the Varners.

filmography.title: Moby Dick
filmography.role_description: A preacher who delivers a fiery sermon about Jonah and the Whale to the whalers before they set sail.
filmography.plot: The sole survivor of a lost whaling ship relates the tale of his captain's self-destructive obsession to hunt the white whale, Moby Dick.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Mr. Arkadin
filmography.role_description: A wealthy financier suffering from amnesia who hires a smuggler to investigate his own mysterious past.
filmography.plot: An American adventurer investigates the past of mysterious tycoon Gregory Arkadin, placing himself in grave danger.

filmography.title: Catch-22
filmography.role_description: A stern, no-nonsense visiting general who is baffled by the absurdity of the military bureaucracy.
filmography.plot: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

filmography.title: Tomorrow Is Forever
filmography.role_description: A WWI soldier presumed dead who returns home with a new identity to find his wife remarried.
filmography.plot: A man presumed dead in World War I returns to America with a new face and identity, only to find his wife has remarried.

filmography.title: Journey into Fear
filmography.role_description: The head of the Turkish secret police who tries to protect an American engineer from Nazi agents.
filmography.plot: An American ballistics expert in Turkey finds himself targeted by Nazi agents.

filmography.title: Prince of Foxes
filmography.role_description: The ruthless and ambitious Italian nobleman who employs a spy to help him conquer a duchy.
filmography.plot: A Renaissance adventurer is sent by Cesare Borgia to manipulate a dukedom into marriage but has a change of heart.

filmography.title: Black Magic
filmography.role_description: The infamous 18th-century charlatan and hypnotist who uses his powers for political intrigue and revenge.
filmography.plot: The story of Cagliostro, a gypsy who becomes a powerful mesmerist and plots against the French monarchy.

filmography.title: The V.I.P.s
filmography.role_description: A celebrated film director who needs to leave London immediately to avoid a ruinous tax bill.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers are delayed at London Heathrow Airport by fog, and the delay causes various personal dramas to unfold.

filmography.title: Waterloo
filmography.role_description: The restored King of France who is forced to flee when Napoleon returns from exile.
filmography.plot: Facing the decline of everything he has worked to obtain, conqueror Napoleon Bonaparte and his army confront the British at the Battle of Waterloo.

filmography.title: The Immortal Story
filmography.role_description: A wealthy merchant in Macao who attempts to make a sailor's legend come true by hiring people to act it out.
filmography.plot: A wealthy merchant decides to make an old sailor's tale come true by paying a young sailor to impregnate his 'wife'.

filmography.title: The Transformers: The Movie
filmography.role_description: A massive, planet-eating robot who serves as the ultimate antagonist; Welles' final film role.
filmography.plot: The Autobots must stop a colossal planet-consuming robot who goes after the Autobot Matrix of Leadership.
